channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Venezuela: Maduro's enforcer Cabello still central to power
item.description: The ousting of Venezuela's president raised hopes of change — but the politician now controlling the streets shows how little has really shifted.
item.content:encoded:
The ousting of Venezuela's president raised hopes of change — but the politician now controlling the streets shows how little has really shifted.

(Image credit: FEDERICO PARRA)
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: Amid ICE clashes, New Hampshire bishop urges clergy to prepare their wills
item.description: The Episcopal bishop of New Hampshire told priests protesting ICE to get their wills and affairs in order. Some praise the bishop, while other priests say they never signed up to be martyrs.
item.content:encoded:
The Episcopal bishop of New Hampshire told priests protesting ICE to get their wills and affairs in order. Some praise the bishop, while other priests say they never signed up to be martyrs.

(Image credit: Elena Eberwein/NHPR)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: New York Giants hire John Harbaugh as coach after identifying him as their top choice
item.description: Harbaugh joins the Giants 11 days after he was fired by the Baltimore Ravens. The Super Bowl champion is now tasked with turning around a beleaguered franchise.
item.content:encoded:
Harbaugh joins the Giants 11 days after he was fired by the Baltimore Ravens. The Super Bowl champion is now tasked with turning around a beleaguered franchise.

(Image credit: Carolyn Kaster)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: US launches new retaliatory strike in Syria, killing leader tied to deadly Islamic State ambush
item.description: A third round of retaliatory strikes by the U.S. in Syria has resulted in the death of an Al-Qaeda-affiliated leader, said U.S. Central Command.
item.content:encoded:
A third round of retaliatory strikes by the U.S. in Syria has resulted in the death of an Al-Qaeda-affiliated leader, said U.S. Central Command.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: NASA's Artemis II craft meets the launch pad ahead of crewed lunar orbit
item.description: Mission Artemis plans to send Americans to the moon for the first time since the Nixon administration.
item.content:encoded:
Mission Artemis plans to send Americans to the moon for the first time since the Nixon administration.

(Image credit: Derek Demeter)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Trump says 8 EU countries to be charged 10% tariff for opposing US control of Greenland
item.description: In a post on social media, Trump said a 10% tariff will take effect on Feb. 1, and will climb to 25% on June 1 if a deal is not in place for the United States to purchase Greenland.
item.content:encoded:
In a post on social media, Trump said a 10% tariff will take effect on Feb. 1, and will climb to 25% on June 1 if a deal is not in place for the United States to purchase Greenland.

(Image credit: Emil Helms)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 'Not for sale': massive protest in Copenhagen against Trump's desire to acquire Greenland
item.description: Thousands of people rallied in Copenhagen to push back on President Trump's rhetoric that the U.S. should acquire Greenland.
item.content:encoded:
Thousands of people rallied in Copenhagen to push back on President Trump's rhetoric that the U.S. should acquire Greenland.

(Image credit: EMIL HELMS/Ritzau Scanpix/AFP via Getty Ima)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Uganda's longtime leader declared winner in disputed vote
item.description: Museveni claims victory in Uganda's contested election as opposition leader Bobi Wine goes into hiding amid chaos, violence and accusations of fraud.
item.content:encoded:
Museveni claims victory in Uganda's contested election as opposition leader Bobi Wine goes into hiding amid chaos, violence and accusations of fraud.

(Image credit: Luis TATO)
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: Opinion: Remembering Ai, a remarkably intelligent chimpanzee
item.description: We remember Ai, a highly intelligent chimpanzee who lived at the Primate Research Institute of Kyoto University for most of her life, except the time she escaped and walked around campus.
item.content:encoded:
We remember Ai, a highly intelligent chimpanzee who lived at the Primate Research Institute of Kyoto University for most of her life, except the time she escaped and walked around campus.

(Image credit: AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: The near death -- and last-minute reprieve -- of a trial for an HIV vaccine
item.description: A trial was about to launch for a vaccine that would ward off the HIV virus. It would be an incredible breakthrough. Then it looked as if it would be over before it started.
item.content:encoded:
A trial was about to launch for a vaccine that would ward off the HIV virus. It would be an incredible breakthrough. Then it looked as if it would be over before it started.

(Image credit: Tommy Trenchard for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel
